title: record --explicit flag of a run call?

labels.name: cmd-run/rerun
labels.description: Issues about the favorite command of ReproPeople

body:
At present a `run` record does not report whether it was produced with `--explicit` or not. That forces a user to decide on `rerun` whether or not to use `--explicit` (and its docstring rightfully suggests to be careful with that).

However, besides running on a dirty dataset, the `--explicit` flag is instrumental in saving only select outputs. In that case, running `rerun` without explicit will lead to different results, even if all outcomes are bit-identical. Rerun only allows to put an an entire rerun run ;-) into explicit mode, but in practice the explicitness can vary from record to record.

Maybe

1. starting on a dirty dataset
2. only saving explicitly listed outputs

are two different things that should not be triggered together with a single option. (2) looks like a candidate for inclusion into a run record itself.
